author: JooHyeon Heo
title: Groundbreaking Study Unveils Solvent-Free Dry Electrodes Boost LIB Performance
text:
Abstract
[Conventional wet-electrode manufacturing encounters challenges in producing thicker electrodes due to issues related to solvent evaporation. This study introduces a novel method for fabricating solvent-free dry electrodes using polytetrafluoroethylene (PTFE) as a binder, representing a significant advancement in electrode manufacturing processes. By eliminating the use of solvents, this method not only addresses these challenges but also offers a scalable and practical solution for mass production. The process is meticulously structured into sequential unit operations, each specifically tailored for a distinct function, utilizing the distinctive fibrillation properties of PTFE. Intermediate product specifications for each phase are clearly defined, accompanied by a comprehensive analysis of both physical and electrochemical performances. This analysis highlights the influence of varying PTFE contents and properties on the microstructure of the dry electrode. Notably, the study achieves a significant breakthrough with an electrode formulation of NCM811/PTFE/carbon black (CB)/carbon nanotube (CNT) = 96/2.0/1.8/0.2, which demonstrates exceptional discharge rate capability of 80 % at a 0.5 C-rate (5 mA/cm2) under the demanding parameters of 10 mAh/cm2 and 3.8 g/cc. This approach not only enhances the microstructural properties of dry electrodes but also paves the way for environmentally friendly and efficient electrode manufacturing for future energy storage applications.]
A team of researchers, affiliated with UNIST has made a significant breakthrough in developing an eco-friendly dry electrode manufacturing process for lithium-ion batteries (LIBs). The new process, which does not require the use of harmful solvents, enhances battery performance while promoting sustainability.
Led by Professor Kyeong-Min Jeong in the School of Energy and Chemical Engineering at UNIST, the research team has introduced a novel solvent-free dry electrode process using polytetrafluoroethylene (PTFE) as a binder. This innovative approach addresses the challenges associated with traditional wet-electrode manufacturing methods, which often result in non-uniform distribution of binders and conductive materials, leading to performance degradation.
Figure 1. Overview of dry electrode manufacturing process: unit processes, equipment, and intermediate products used in this study.
The dry electrode process is divided into four stages: granule formation, film formation, rolling, and lamination. The team optimized the process conditions by evaluating the physical, electrical, and electrochemical properties of semi-finished products at each stage. The results showed that a high-extrusion-ratio PTFE binder can produce an electrode film with high strength even with low energy consumption, leading to improved microstructure and power characteristics.
Figure 2. Schematic diagram showing the fibrillation process of the PTFE binder with kneading time, photographs of the bulk shape, and SEM images of the microstructure of the electrode dough (F-208 2%).
In LIBs, binders play a crucial role in connecting active materials and electrons. The study revealed that the type and content of PTFE binders significantly impact the output characteristics of dry electrodes. The researchers identified an optimal formulation of NCM811/PTFE/carbon black (CB)/carbon nanotube (CNT) = 96/2.0/1.8/0.2, which demonstrated exceptional discharge rate capability of 80% at a 0.5 C-rate (5 mA/cm2) under demanding conditions.
“This breakthrough will contribute to commercialization by providing a scalable and practical solution for mass production,” emphasized Professor Jeong. “We believe that our study will pave the way for environmentally friendly and efficient electrode manufacturing for future energy storage applications.”
Figure 3. Film formation – roll mill – electrode film. (a) Schematic of the manufacture of electrode film from electrode granules using a roll mill. (b) Photographs of the electrode film by type and amount of PTFE after roll milling.
The findings of this research have been published in the July 2024 issue of Chemical Engineering Journal. It has been carried out through the support of the National Research Council of Science and Technology (NST) and the Ministry of Science and ICT (MSIT).
Meanwhile, the Korea Institute of Energy Research (KIER) and Hanwha Co., Ltd. have also partnered with UNIST to develop dry electrode-specific manufacturing equipment and demonstrate its commercial viability from the second half of this year. The team is planning to further improve the output characteristics of thick electrodes by exploring various materials through follow-up research. With this innovative technology, electric vehicles and electronic devices are expected to become more sustainable in the future.
Journal Reference
Hyeseong Oh, Gyu-Sang Kim, Byung Un Hwang, et al., “Development of a feasible and scalable manufacturing method for PTFE-based solvent-free lithium-ion battery electrodes,” Chemical Eng. Journal, (2024).

author: Canva press contact
title: Canva and Google for Education Launch Integration to Bring Creativity to Classrooms at Scale
text:
Canva and Google for Education Launch Integration to Bring Creativity to Classrooms at Scale
Canva and Google for Education Launch Integration to Bring Creativity to Classrooms at Scale
Canva for Education now available through Google Workspace for Education integration, offering seamless deployment and unlocking creativity for teachers and students worldwide.
SYDNEY--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Canva, the world’s only all-in-one visual communication platform, and Google have today unveiled their latest collaboration, introducing the Google for Education app licensing integration for Canva for Education. This cutting-edge collaboration enables school and district administrators to deploy Canva quickly and easily through Google Workspace for Education, empowering teachers and students to unlock classroom creativity with just a few clicks.
With Google app licensing, districts can now deploy Canva in just minutes.
[Share]
This integration simplifies license distribution and reduces administrative workloads, making it easier for school and district leaders to deploy Canva at scale. By simplifying access, Canva and Google for Education are empowering educators to bring world-class creativity tools into the classroom and helping to prepare students for success in an increasingly digital world.
“Our partnership with Google is reshaping how schools access and implement technology,” said Carly Daff, Canva’s Head of Teams & Education. “With Google app licensing, districts can now deploy Canva in just minutes. This collaboration is about removing barriers so that every student and teacher can easily tap into their creative potential. Together, we’re building a streamlined education technology ecosystem that’s simpler, smarter, and more impactful.”
A seamless, scalable solution for schools
Google’s app licensing for Canva for Education addresses key challenges faced by schools and districts, offering:
- Instant Deployment: Schools can activate Canva licenses through Google Admin console, reducing setup time from weeks to minutes.
- Automated Onboarding: Staff and student accounts are created automatically, enabling a one click sign-in and onboarding experience.
- Enhanced Security: Built on Google’s trusted infrastructure, GAL ensures data privacy and compliance with global education standards, including FERPA and COPPA.
- Scalability: Flexible license management through Google Workspace for Education allows schools and districts of any size to deploy Canva efficiently.
“Google’s app licensing integration was born out of a desire to simplify life for administrators and make it as easy as possible for them to put great education tools in the hands of teachers and students. Partnering with Canva to launch the app licensing integration will further this mission, and ensure that teachers and students across the globe are able to access the world class creativity tools Canva for Education has to offer.” said Alisa Sommer O’Hara, Google’s Global Head of EdTech Partnerships
Empowering Creativity with Canva for Education
Canva for Education is free for all K-12 schools, offering access to premium creative tools, over 100,000 educational templates, and robust collaboration features. With Google for Education app licensing, schools can now deploy Canva instantly, removing barriers to adoption and opening doors for more students and teachers to create, collaborate, and learn. Find out more here.
Contacts
Canva press contact
comms@canva.com
Google press contact
press@google.com

According to the survey, 81% of employees who feel highly appreciated report elevated job satisfaction, compared to just 7% among those who feel unappreciated or neutral. The study also revealed that 94% of employees who feel high...

author: US ARMY
title: Exclusive-US believes drone that killed soldiers was Iranian-made, sources say | U.S. & World | gazette.com
text: By Phil Stewart and Idrees Ali WASHINGTON (Reuters) -The United States has assessed that Iran manufactured the drone that slammed into a U.S. base in Jordan over the weekend, killing three American soldiers and wounding more than 40, four U.S. officials told Reuters. Washington has blamed the attack - the first to kill U.S. troops in the Middle East since the start of the Israel-Hamas war in October - on Iran-backed militants, and President Joe Biden's administration has promised a multi-tiered response that will include strikes. But it has stopped short of publicly saying where the actual weapon that killed the Americans came from, even as it acknowledged Iran's ultimate responsibility for funding and even in some cases training the militants responsible. The officials, who spoke to Reuters on condition of anonymity, did not provide the model of the drone and said analysis was still ongoing. While the initial indications were that the drone was likely Iranian, a formal assessment was made only recently after recovering fragments of the drone. U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin, asked about the matter at a news briefing following the Reuters report, stopped short of confirming the drone's origin. "We're still doing the forensics," Austin said. "But most of the drones that are in the region have a connection with Iran. So ..." Austin said he didn't know whether Iran knew about the attack ahead of time, but added that, in his view, it didn't matter. "How much Iran knew or didn't know, we don't know. But it really doesn't matter because Iran sponsors these groups, it funds these groups, and in some cases, it trains these groups on advanced, conventional weapons," he said. Kataib Hezbollah, a pro-Iranian militia based in Iraq, said on Tuesday it was suspending military actions against the United States to avoid embarrassing the Baghdad government. Biden's administration said it was not seeking a war with Iran, even as Republican pressure on him to respond forcefully has been rising. Iranian officials have said Tehran will respond to any threat from the United States. Iran's envoy to the U.S. said Tehran would respond decisively to any attack on its territory, its interests, or Iranian nationals outside its borders. U.S. troops have been attacked more than 160 times in Iraq, Syria and Jordan since the events of Oct. 7 that triggered the war in Gaza, and warships have seen attacks in the Red Sea as well. Houthi fighters in Yemen have fired drones and missiles at them on the Red Sea ins solidarity with the Palestinians. Amid expectations of multiday strikes, Austin suggested it would take a multitiered response to address threats by Iran-backed groups against U.S. forces. "I don't think the adversaries are of a one-and-done mindset," Austin told reporters. "And so, they have a lot of capability. I have a lot more. ... We're going to do what's necessary to protect our troops and our interests." The attack in Jordan, and any U.S. response, is likely to stoke fears of wider conflict in the Middle East following the Oct. 7 raid in southern Israel by the Palestinian Islamist group Hamas in which the Israeli authorities said 1,200 people were killed and 253 taken hostage. Israel's subsequent assault on Gaza has killed over 27,000 Palestinians, according to the local health ministry. The United States has already retaliated in Iraq, Syria and Yemen in response to previous attacks by Iran-backed groups. Experts have cautioned that any strikes against Iranian forces inside Iran could force Tehran to respond, escalating the situation in a way that could drag the United States into a major Middle East war. (Reporting by Phil Stewart and Idrees Ali; Editing by Don Durfee, Timothy Heritage and Jonathan Oatis)

author: Emanuel Zapata
title: Perú vs Bolivia se podrá ver totalmente gratis en YouTube: canal peruano anunció transmisión del partido por las Eliminatorias 2026
text:
Perú vs Bolivia se podrá ver totalmente gratis en YouTube: canal peruano anunció transmisión del partido por las Eliminatorias 2026
¡Sin precedentes! La selección peruana recibirá a la Verde por la fecha 13 de las clasificatorias y, aparte de los canales televisivos que normalmente lo transmiten, podrás ver el encuentro de manera online.
La selección peruana enfrentará a Bolivia en el Estadio Nacional por las Eliminatorias 2026. Foto: composición GLR
A través de la transmisión del Alianza Lima vs San Martín por la Liga Peruana de Vóley, los comentaristas del duelo anunciaron que el encuentro de Perú ante Bolivia por las Eliminatorias será transmitido por el canal de YouTube de Movistar Deportes. Ahora, el mencionado canal no solo televisará el choque por cable, sino también de manera online.
¿A qué hora juegan Perú vs Bolivia por las Eliminatorias 2026?
El cotejo entre Perú vs Bolivia en este reinicio de las clasificatorias sudamericanas está programado para las 8.30 p. m. (hora peruana) y 9.30 p. m. (hora boliviana) en el Estadio Nacional.

author: Michelle Devani
title: 32 Reasons Why You Should Marry Your High School Sweetheart
text:
High school sweetheart is someone that is our true love in high school. Usually in high school, our love is wild, adventurous, and insanely romantic which means you should really take things further.
When you are dating your high school sweetheart you might not think of the future but you should. They are the ones that deserve the spot as your husband or wife and grow old with you. Are you not sure why? Here are the real reasons why you should marry your high school sweetheart;
You Already Know That Person Knowing that person already leads you to become more confident in them and in the relationship altogether.
Already Comfortable With Each Other You are already comfortable enough to be with each other so why waste time finding someone else?
The Rough Patches Are Already Solved High school are the peak of emotion and can lead to emotional fights. If you have gone through that, you can get through anything.
You Grow Together Growing with each other will happen in high school and you will become more adjusted to it in your marriage.
You Will Have A Youthful Marriage Why you should marry your high school sweetheart - You can always reminisce on your good days. Plus keeping them around will always make you feel youthful.
Chance Of Having An Adventurous Marriage Adventures and fun will never stop when you are marrying your high school sweetheart.
Already Knowing The People In Each Other’s Life Being accustomed to the people in each other’s life can make it a smoother transition to your married life.
Already Commited To Each Other You are already committed with each other on high school so you just have to continue it until marriage. This will lessen the Signs He's Thinking of Cheating On You
Breaking It Off Would Be Painful If you do break it off, even the Ways to Break Up with Your Girlfriend Without Hurting Her Feelings won’t make things better and you will lose your best friend.
You Will Always Go Back To Each Other Even if you are apart, you will slowly find that you want to go back to each other. So why not be committed now.
You Will Have A Stable Marriage Being with someone for so long can make you have a stable marriage so you can stay happy and content.
Already Know The People That You Can Trust Why you should marry your high school sweetheart - Both of you already know the people you can trust so you can have less worry .
Making You Less Likely To End Up In A Bad Marriage The percentage of plunging into a bad marriage will be decreased when you amrry someone you already know and you are already comfortable with.
Giving You More Chances To Grow And Change When you feel comfortable that someone will show the signs that a man loves you unconditionally. you will be more likely to be comfortable to grow and change into a better person which is important according to the Reasons You Should Know and Love Yourself Before You Love Someone Else
Not Being Too Needy With Each Other You already trust each other and are already independent.
Having Almost The Same Mindset Being with someone for a long time can make you have the same mindset.
Not Afraid Of Changes Coming Your Way With one constant person in your life, you are no longer afraid of the changes that is coming your way.
Not Experiencing Unwanted Heartbreaks You don’t waste your time being heartbroken by someone unimportant.
Always Having Someone To Protect You You don’t feel the Signs of Conditional Love
That Person Can Expect What You Need That person knows you enough to expect what you need.
Contents
Tips on why you should be committed to your high school love Commitment like marriage is absolutely worth it when you are marrying someone you are sure with, like your high school sweetheart. If you are not convinced yet, here are more reasons why you should be committed to your high school love;
Raising A Great Family Is More Than Possible Because of the stability, raising a family will be great.
You Can Continue To Surprise Each Other Wiht the growth accompanied by loyalty, you can always surprise each other.
Making You Have Less Stress And Anxiety Anxiety around relationships will be decreased.
Making You Trust People More The trust you have in the relationship will be projected to other people.
Making You Have A Healthier Relationship With Other People You’ve learnt what a great relatiosnhip is and you will be more likely to have that with other people.
You Will Never Feel Alone Always having someone by yourself is great.
Ways to marry your first love You are probably more than convinced that yous should marry your first love now but how do you exactly marry them? here are the interesting ways to marry your first love;
Know The Right Words To Say To Propose Always learn how to express your love through words.
Have A Sentimental Wedding Have a wedding that looks back on the relationship you had when you were young and to reflect on how much you’ve grown.
Have The People You Love With You Have the people you love on the wedding so it can be a great wedding.
Write A Sentimental Vow A vow that tells them how much you really love them is going to be wonderful.
Continue To Have A Great Marriage Try to show the ways to say I love you without saying I love you always.
Our high school sweetheart teach us how to mix adventures, high curiosity, stability, and love altogether. They are the ones that really makes us grow. All of this is a good reason enough to convince you to marry him but you need to be more convinced by believing the reasons why you should marry your high school sweetheart. From then on you can have a great wedding and an even more adventurous marriage.

author: Il Secolo XIX
title: “Non fate l’elemosina ai mendicanti”. Il cartello che indigna i fedeli in una chiesa di Padova
text: “Non fate l’elemosina ai mendicanti”. Il cartello che indigna i fedeli in una chiesa di Padova Don Bizzotto dei Beati costruttori di pace: «Sono scandalizzato». L’Opera dell’Adorazione eucaristica perpetua di via Santa Lucia: «Gli accattoni gravitano notte e giorno qui intorno, disturbano e danno senso di insicurezza ai passanti» C’è chi è rimasto a fissarlo e chi ha commentato, andandosene sconcertato. La questione riguarda un cartello affisso in una chiesa di Padova in cui si chiede di non aiutare chi è in difficoltà. Esattamente le parole riportate sono le seguenti: «I fedeli sono pregati di non dare l’elemosina ai mendicanti in chiesa e nemmeno nei dintorni». Parole che stridono fortemente con il luogo in cui è stato appeso oltre che il periodo natalazio, in cui tutti si dovrebbe, sottolineando “dovrebbe”, essere più buoni e predisposti verso gli altri. La chiesa in questione è quella dell’Adorazione eucaristica perpetua di via Santa Lucia, in centro a Padova. «Sono scandalizzato, e mi dispiace che sotto Natale non ci sia posto per i poveri in chiesa», ha commentato al Mattino di Padova don Albino Bizzotto, presidente dell’associazione Beati costruttori di pace. La richiesta va contro i principi cristiani della solidarietà e dell’aiuto ai poveri. Ed è saltato all’occhio dei fedeli, provocandone l’indignazione. Ma l’Opera dell’Adorazione eucaristica perpetua sostiene con forza l’iniziativa: bandita non è l’elemosina, ha precisato, quanto la pratica dell’accattonaggio molesto. «La chiesa resta sempre aperta, 24 ore su 24. È per questo che noi abbiamo anche il compito di garantire il rispetto e il silenzio in tutti quei momenti di intimo raccoglimento dei fedeli», spiega una referente dell’opera religiosa al Mattino. «Essendo una chiesa sempre aperta e non una parrocchia, gli accattoni gravitano intorno al luogo di culto a tutte le ore e non solo durante le occasionali funzioni religiose, anche di notte. Questo ha portato problemi anche ai commercianti della zona che si sono lamentati per la presenza costante di gente che chiede l’elemosina”, ha concluso la referente. “Alcuni fedeli sono stati avvicinati in orari notturni da alcuni mendicanti molesti che in modo insistente hanno chiesto denaro, non solo disturbando i momenti di culto, ma diffondendo anche un certo senso di insicurezza». Ma per don Albino Bizzotto non ci sono scuse. «I poveri meritano attenzione soprattutto in questi giorni. Certo, va individuato l’opportunismo, ma non agire in modo generalizzato precludendo ai bisognosi la carità».

author: Abigail Parada
title: Trabajadores administrativos del ISSS fueron trasladados a oficinas más pequeñas
text:
El Sindicato de Trabajadores del Instituto Salvadoreño del Seguro Social (SIMETRISSS) indicó que el traslado del personal administrativo de la Torre del ISSS a oficinas más pequeñas, fue ordenado por las autoridades bajo el argumento de reparar las instalaciones.
Dicha medida inició meses antes y se ha denunciado que las autoridades pretenden reducir el número de empleados administrativos.
Sin embargo, los sindicalistas sospechan que la medida responde a una estrategia para reducir la operatividad del Seguro Social en medio del cierre de varias unidades comunitarias.
El Instituto Salvadoreño del Seguro Social. / Foto EDH Médicos del ISSS denuncian restricciones en permisos y condiciones laborales hostiles Según las declaraciones de representantes de SIMETRISSS, el cambio de sede afectará a cientos de trabajadores que verán reducidos sus espacios de trabajo. “Nos dicen que es por remodelaciones, pero no hay claridad sobre qué tipo de trabajos se realizarán ni cuánto durarán”, expresó un vocero del sindicato.
Los trabajadores del ISSS también han vinculado esta situación con las intenciones de cerrar las unidades comunitarias, lo que consideran una acción perjudicial para la atención médica en el país.
“Estamos viendo un debilitamiento del Seguro Social. Se están cerrando unidades esenciales y ahora nos reubican en espacios reducidos. Esto afecta tanto a los empleados como a los pacientes”, agregaron.
Hasta el momento, las autoridades del ISSS no han brindado una explicación detallada sobre el plan de remodelación ni han respondido a las inquietudes planteadas por los trabajadores. SIMETRISSS ha solicitado transparencia en el proceso.

author: Andrew O’Malley
title: IGT Investigating Cyberattack Ahead of $6.3bn Merger
text:
International Game Technology (IGT) is one of the world’s biggest developers of slot machines, and it’s now the latest gambling company to fall victim to a cyberattack.
The gaming supplier revealed the November 17 breach in an SEC filing, explaining how an unauthorized third party accessed certain systems, disrupting internal operations. No group has taken credit for the attack yet.
quickly implemented its cyberattack response plan
IGT said it quickly implemented its cyberattack response plan after uncovering the hack, with external advisors helping to conduct an internal investigation to determine the impact. Some systems remain offline until it’s safe to bring them back.
IGT is currently [merging its global gaming divisions with gaming technology company Everi](https://www.vegasslotsonline.com/news/2024/07/26/apollo-funds-to-buy-igt-gaming-and-everi-for-6-3bn/), with the latter’s shareholders approving the transaction a few days before the cyberattack. Private equity firm Apollo Global Management will own the new entity after the $6.3bn transaction concludes. IGT will operate its lottery division as its own entity.
Gambling companies are no stranger to cyberattacks. The most high-profile recent incident saw [MGM Resorts International’s systems hit in September 2023](https://www.vegasslotsonline.com/news/2023/09/18/mgm-losing-up-to-8-4m-per-day-as-cyberattack-enters-second-week/), leading to mass disruptions across its US properties. Caesars Entertainment suffered a similar breach around the same time, ultimately paying a $15m ransom to the hackers.

author: Davinia Delgado
title: La ocupación hotelera llega en Córdoba al 70% en el puente con cancelaciones por las inundaciones en Valenc...
text: El rodar de maletas a través de las estrechas calles del Casco Histórico cordobés será su banda sonora durante el inminente Puente de Todos los Santos . Las reservas hablan de una media del 70 por ciento de ocupación hotelera en la capital, que se elevan por encima del 90 por ciento y rozan el lleno en algunos casos. Así lo pone de manifiesto el presidente de la Asociación de Empresarios de Hospedaje , Aehcor, Manuel Fragero, quien, no obstante, también señala que la trágica situación vivida en Valencia por las inundaciones causadas por la DANA «ha afectado a las comunicaciones, y se han registrado algunas cancelaciones ; además, las ventas están ahora paradas. Esperamos que remonten conforme se vaya normalizando todo». De hecho, varias carreteras del Estado en la región valenciana se encuentran cortadas y numerosos servicios de transportes han anulado su circulación . En concreto, el temporal ha dañado las infraestructuras ferroviarias y han obligado a suspender las conexiones de Alta Velocidad entre Valencia y Madrid, que tiene conexión con Córdoba. Esta ruta, y la circulación en el Corredor Mediterráneo, permanecerá inoperativa al menos hasta el domingo.Pese a ello, «los datos de ocupación son positivos y confiamos en que no haya más cancelaciones», indica el presudente de Aehcor. En cuanto a la procedencia de los visitantes, el grueso proviene de otros puntos del territorio nacional , algo que suele suceder en este puente de noviembre. Sin embargo, según detalla Fragero, «también está prevista la llegada de muchos extranjeros ; durante los próximos día es semana blanca en algunos países. Así, hablamos de un 60% de nacionales y de un 40% de foráneos». Noticia Relacionada Meteorología estandar No El tiempo para el puente de noviembre en Córdoba: estos son los días en los que lloverá Davinia Delgado Los chubascos serán muy puntuales y la estabilidad atmosférica será la tónica dominante durante las próximas jornadasLa situación, hotel por hotel, varía y mucho. Una muestra de ello es el Hospes Palacio del Bailío . Su director, Alberto Pérez, destaca los buenos números del establecimiento de cara al Puente de Todos los Santo: «El año pasado llenamos y este, vamos a repetir. A día de hoy sólo nos quedan dos habitaciones libres», afirma.En en Hospes, el grueso de clientes que tiran de los óptimos resultados son extranjeros. «De hecho, vamos a cerrar octubre con un 98,30% de ocupación y se debe a ellos. Además, se mantiene altísima hasta el 25 de noviembre», indica Pérez. Este cinco estrellas, uno de los dos que operan en la capital, cerrará un 2024 por encima de sus expectativas. «Tuvimos un febrero y un marzo muy potentes; y noviembre también lo será, a pesar de ser temporada baja. Contamos con un flujo de clientes americanos muy importante», valora el director del complejo, que se ubica en pleno centro histórico. Los turistas nacionales tiran de la mayoría de las reservasEn la misma línea se pronuncia el director del Parador de La Arruzafa , Manuel Merino. Pese a no ubicarse en el casco [se enclava en la avenida homónima], este establecimiento también cuenta ya con una elevada ocupación para el puente festivo de noviembre. «Estamos prácticamente en un 98 por ciento . A nosotros no nos están afectando las cancelaciones por lo sucedido en Valencia, al menos, por el momento», indica el máximo responsable de este establecimiento.Merino destaca las reservas por parte de madrileños y de visitantes de otros puntos del territorio nacional: «El 80% de los clientes que llegarán vienen de diversas ciudades de España». También de la comunidad madrileña proceden la mayoría de los turistas que se alojarán los próximos días en el hotel Macía Alfaros . «A partir mañana [viernes, 1 de noviembre], estaremos al 96, y el sabado, al 94. Aunque normalmente solemos tener muchos clientes de Francia, Holanda o Alemania, este puente suelen predominar los visitantes españoles », señalan desde su recepción. Algunos cuelgan el cartel de \u0027completo\u0027Otros establecimientos hoteleros consultados por este periódico, como NH Califa o Córdoba Centro , esperan, igualmente, un puente redondo. El primero, según informan, está al 95,38% de ocupación este 31 de octubre; al 90% el viernes y al 80% el sábado, «aunque esperamos que haya más reservas». Por su parte, Córdoba Centro está « completo hasta el lunes», apuntan, incluso con sorpresa, ya que «no suele ser usual algo así. Se debe a que no llega el domingo un grupo de americanos».De este modo, Córdoba saldrá muy bien parada de un festivo que ha estado en la cuerda floja por la previsión meteorológica. Así, la capital resulta beneficiada de la alta demanda de los destinos urbanos que se está registrando para el puente. Madrid, Sevilla y Roma encabezan las búsquedas de alojamientos, según los datos de Booking.com. La capital española lidera el interés de los viajeros nacionales, mientras que Sevilla ocupa el segundo lugar.
